Name: Silver Torso of Aphrodite
Description: The silver statue of Aphrodite, or Venus, although incomplete, is considered astounding. It depicts her nude with locks of hair falling on her shoulders. The head and the arms are broken. The statue, probably of Alexandrian workmanship, reveals the skill of the artist in highlighting the beauty of the goddess. This statue differs in shape and portrayal from other statues of Aphrodite.
